result.execSummary:
The defendant Roscoe Benton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.

No contact with: any victims/witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.
  Complete Criminal Thinking Class.
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Roscoe  Benton in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests the Court schedule the case for plea and sentencing.  The Court schedules accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Roscoe  Benton did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court quashes the capias and schedules the case for a hearing on Monday.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Roscoe  Benton did not appear.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schleis advises the Court the Defendant is in custody at the Milwaukee County Jail. Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment of the trial to allow time to review the newly received offer.  The Court issues a capias and cancels the jury trial.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 16, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on May 11, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Roscoe  Benton in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Tim Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Schleis requests the Court adjourn the trial as indicated in the letter he filed on 2/1/17.  The State does not object to the request. The Court grants the request and adjourns and reschedules the jury trial.  Attorney Suha requests the Court joins the Defendant's two cases.  Attorney Schleis is in agreement. The Court grants the request and schedules accordingly.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 11, 2017 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 16, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Roscoe Benton in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Village of Elm Grove Sargent Joseph Ipavec sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Juech.  Cross examination by Attorney Schleis.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Closing statements.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED, subject to the request for substitution.  Attorney Schleis requests the further proceedings be scheduled 45-60 days out as there may be more charges being filed.
